Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a bowl. Set the mixture aside. Cream the butter and sugar. Beat in the egg and vanilla extract. Once combined, slowly blend in the dry ingredients until evenly mixed. Searate dough into tablespoon-sized balls. Place onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Place on center rack and bake for 5 to 7 minutes. Let the cookies sit for 2 minutes before cooling on wire racks. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Spread nuts evenly over the pan, shaking lightly until all nuts stick. Cool until hard. Break into pieces. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Stir together salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin and cinnamon. Coat the pork with the lime beer marinade. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a 12 inch skillet, over relatively high heat, and brown pork, turning every 30 seconds for 4 minutes. Stir together brown sugar, garlic, and tabasco and pat onto top of the tenderloin. Place pork in roasting pan and cook for 20 minutes.
Boil and drain noodles. In a large bowl, mix all ingredients except the topping. Pour into greased 8 x 8 baking pan. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until knife inserted into the center comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 400f, grease a 15 x 10 inch baking pan. Mix together butter, oats, sugar, corn syrup, vanilla and salt. Press into prepared pan and bake 15 to 18 minutes until the mixture is brown and bubbly. Remove from the oven and immediately sprinkle on the chocolate, set aside for 10 minutes, then spread the chocolate over the base. Sprinkle on nuts, cool on a wire rack, then cut into squares.

Put the sliced onions, vinegar, sugar, mustard and celery seeds, and salt in a large metallic pot. Cook at medium-high for 15 minutes. Remove from heat, and add the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Gently put the sliced onions, vinegar, sugar, mustard and celery seeds, and salt in a large metallic pot.

In a large nonstick saut pan over medium heat, combine cooked rice and whole milk. Heat until mixture begins to boil. Decrease heat to low and cook to a simmer, stirring occasionally, until mixture just begins to thicken, approximately 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium, add heavy cream, coconut milk, sugar, and cardamom. Continue to cook until mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 5-10 minutes. Use a whisk to prevent the cardamom from clumping. Once mixture begins to thicken, remove from heat and stir in raisins and pistachios. Once mixture begins to

In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and sugar. Temper small amounts of the tapioca into the egg mixture until you have added at least 1 cup. Add this back into the remaining tapioca in the slow cooker. Add the lemon zest and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 15 minutes, stirring at least once. Transfer the pudding to a bowl and cover the surface with plastic wrap. Allow to cool at room temperature for 1 hour and then place in the refrigerator until thoroughly chilled.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until onion is translucent, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes with their liquid, pinto beans, lima beans, brown sugar, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until lima beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in white kidney beans, heat through. To serve, ladle soup into warm serving bowl. Sprinkle with 1 to 2 ounces shredded cheddar cheese if desired.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Place ham in a 13x9 baking pan. Pour apple cider over ham. In medium bowl stir together remaining ingredients. Spoon sauce over entire ham. Bake, basting every 15 minutes with pan juices for 60 to 70 minutes or until heated through. Serve carved ham with pan juices, garnish with apple slices.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray an 11x7 inch baking dish with pam. Salt and pepper the chicken breast halves and place in the dish. In a bowl, combine the artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, garlic cloves, chicken broth, cream cheese, artichoke hearts, fresh lemon juice, ground red pepper. Mix well. Spread artichoke mixture over chicken breasts. Bake, uncovered, 30-35 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease bottom and side of a 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle vegetable mix into pie plate. In medium bowl, stir remaining ingredients until blended. Pour over vegetable mixture. Bake uncovered 35 to 40 minutes in preheated oven or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling, salted water until tender, but firm, 8 to 12 minutes, stirring often. Drain well and rinse with cold water. Shake out excess water and toss pasta with oil. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic powder, milk, tomatoes, black olives, sharp cheddar cheese, salt and pepper. Place pasta in large pot of boiling, salted water until tender, but firm, 8 to 12 minutes, stirring often. Drain well and rinse with cold

Preheat oven to 325f. In small saucepan, melt chocolate chips and margarine over low heat, stirring until well blended. Cool slightly. In a large bowl, beat eggs with whisk until foamy and light yellow in color. Beat in sugar, vanilla, and chip mixture. Add flour, mixing well. Pour into a lightly greased 13x 9-inch pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until brownies pull away from pan or until set in center. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Saute the chicken in hot oil for 5-8 minutes or until no longer pink, stirring constantly. Add the mushrooms, garlic, ginger, and cayenne pepper. Cook 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add in the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, and cooked pasta. Toss to coat. Cook a couple of minutes or until pasta is heated through. Add in the mushrooms, garlic, ginger, and cayenne pepper

Heat olive oil in a small pan and fry chili for 3-4 minutes over a low heat. Stir in chopped red pepper. Drain sweet potato and garlic and mash with 2 tbsp cream cheese and milk, adding more if needed. Stir red pepper, chili and coriander into mash. Add salt and black pepper to taste.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and saute until butter is melted. Add parmesan cheese and saute until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Add parmesan cheese and

Combine all ingredients together in a blender. Cover and blend until smooth. Press fruit mixture through a fine-mesh strainer over a bowl to extract juices. Discard solids and pour mixture into 3-ounce paper or plastic drink cups or pop molds. Cover cups with foil. Cut a slit in the foil and insert wooden sticks. Freeze 8 hours or overnight until firm.

Combine all ingredients except the meat in a medium bowl. Place the meat in a shallow glass or ceramic dish in one layer. Pour marinade over and turn meat to coat well. Marinate at room temperature for at least 2 hours. Drain meat. Thread on 6 skewers and grill 10 to 12 minutes, turning to cook all sides.

Heat a large saucepan over a low heat and add the butter. When the butter has melted, add the onion and cook until soft and translucent. Add the mushrooms, season with salt and pepper to taste, then increase the heat and stir. When the moisture from the mushrooms has been released, allow it to evaporate, concentrating the flavour. This might happen quickly or slowly, depending entirely on the type of mushrooms used. Add teh paprika and cayenne and fry for a few moments longer, until the paprika turns a shade darker. Finally, add teh sour cream or creme fraiche and dill, and allow it to bubbvle gently for a further 5 minutes or so.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a large mixing bowl, beat butter and sugar together until creamy. Beat in egg and vanilla. Add flour gradually and beat well. Stir in 1 cup morsels. Press on bottom of ungreased 9x13 baking pan. Bake for 30-33 minutes or until the top is lightly browned. Immediately sprinkle with the remaining chocolate chips and let sit for 5 minutes or so until the chips become shiny. Then spread evenly over top. Cool completely in the pan and then cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 400. Cover a glass baking dish with aluminum foil and place the chicken breasts on top. Zest all 3 of the lemons into a small bowl, and then add the juice of 2 of the lemons. Add the pepper and all the other ingredients into the bowl. Mix the combine and pour over all the chicken breasts. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and drizzle with the lemon juice of the last lemon, and a few more grinds from pepper mill.

Place the asparagus in a large frying pan with about 1 inch of boiling water. Cover with lid and cook for about 6-8 minutes, until the asparagus is tender but still firm. Drain well. Arrange the asparagus spears on a warmed serving dish. Make the tarragon butter by creaming together the remaining ingredients. Heat it gently and pour over asparagus. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray large baking sheet with nonstick spray. Toss onion and next 5 ingredients together on prepared baking sheet. Spread in single layer. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake vegetables until tender and brown around edges, stirring occasionally, about 35 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In a medium saucepan mix all ingredients together. Bring to a light boil, whisking constantly until thickened. Remove from heat, cool slightly then whisk in mayo. Season with salt and pepper. Cool completely before adding to you potato or pasta salad.

In a small saucepan, heat butter and oil over medium-high heat. Saute onion until softened, about 5 minutes. Add chicken broth, stir to incorporate, and bring to boiling point. Cover pan, remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork, season with salt if needed, and serve hot.

Heat the oil in a heavy pan over medium heat. Add the sausage pieces and cook until brown, about 5 minutes. Add the onions, green peppers, and celery. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the water, tomato sauce, salt and pepper. Heat to boiling. Stir in the rice. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook covered, until rice is tender, about 30 minutes. Remove from heat and keep covered until time to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a greased 10 x 15 cookie sheet evenly with graham crackers. Combine brown sugar and butter and bring to a boil in microwave or on stovetop. Pour mixture over crackers and sprinkle with nuts and chips. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool in refrigerator. Cut or separate into bars.

Preheat oven to 350deg. Grease 13x9 inch baking pan. Crust. Beat flour, butter, and brown sugar in small mixer bowl until crumbly. Press into pan, bake for 12-15 min until lightly brown. Filling. Beat eggs, cornsyrup, granulated sugar, butter and vanilla in med bowl with wire wisk. Stir in chunks and nuts. Pour evenly over baked crust. Bake for 25-30 min or until set. Cool completely in pan on wire rack.

Place chicken pieces in a shallow baking dish. Add lemon slices, garlic cloves and rosemary. Roast in a preheated 200c oven for about 35 minutes. You will need to shake the pan from time to time during the cooking process to prevent sticking. Place chicken pieces in a shallow baking dish. You will need to shake the pan from

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. and grease a 12 hole donut pan. In a large mixing bowl stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, nutmeg, salt, buttermilk, eggs, butter, stir until just combined. Divide batter between prepared donut pan. Bake until toothpick comes out clean, 7 to 9 minutes. Let donuts cool in pans for 5 minutes then take them out of pan and let cool on a cooling rack.

Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon juice, malibu rum, light syrup, ice, coarse sugar, lime wedgepreparation:Mix the lime juice, sugar, lemon

Preheat oven to 400f grease an 8-inch square baking dish. Using a food processor, puree 1 cup corn. In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the chorizo. In a large bowl, beat the eggs. Stir in the milk, pureed corn and tortilla crumbs. Add the onion-chorizo mixture and season with salt and pepper. Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan and bake until set and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Let sit for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with the scallions.

In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook garlic until tender and fragrant but not browned, about 1 minute. Add shrimp and mix well. Pour in stock and bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat and simmer gently for 20 to 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in dill. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper to taste.

Place all the filling mixture in a large crock-pot then sprinkle with salt & pepper. Pour the tortilla sauce over the chicken then cover & cook on low for 4 hours. Remove the chicken & shred. Whisk in the cheese soup until smooth then add the chicken, beans, & chili powder. Continue to cook for another 2 hours. During the last 30 minutes add the cream cheese, stir to melt. Serve with tortilla chips.

Place lime wedge on glass rim of 3 glasses to moisten them. Dip the rims into the salt to lightly coat the edges of the glasses. Place the glasses in the freezer to chill. Place the ice, water, limeade concentrate and lime juice in the container of a blender. Process until combined and slushy. Pour into the prepared glasses. Garnish each glass with a lime slice, if desired. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Beat cream cheese at medium speed of electric mixer until fluffy. Mix in sugar. Add eggs one at a time, making sure the mixture is well blended. Stir in vanilla. Line 12 muffin cups with muffin paper, and place a chocolate wafer in each lined cup. Spoon the cream cheese mixture over the wafers. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove cheesecakes from the muffin pan. To serve, spoon a tablespoon of cherry pie filling on each mini cheesecake.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a medium sized bowl, combine all ingredients mixing well. If mixture looks a little too dry, add a little more mayonnaise until. Desired moistness is reached. Now taste to see if seasonings need to be adjusted. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours.

Preheat oven to 200c or 180c fan. Using kitchen scissors or poultry shears, cut down either side of the backbones of chickens and discard. Open out chickens and flatten, pressing with the heel of your hand. Rub chicken skin with cut lemon. Reserve lemons. Combine oil, garlic, oregano, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, cayenne pepper and salt, and rub into skin. Arrange chickens skin side up in a large baking dish and add reserved lemons. Roast for 45 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through. Set aside to rest for 10 minutes, then carve into pieces. Drizzle with reserved pan juices to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all dry ingredients in a mixing bowl and mix up with an electric mixer. Add the liquids and mix smooth. Place 2 tablespoons of batter in the bottom of each of the greased muffin cups. Add 1 tablespoon of crunchy style peanut butter. Add the remaining bit of batter and bake for approx. 25 minutes or until a tooth pick comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl stir together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla. On low speed gradually add flour mixture and mix just until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes. Transfer cookies to cooling racks to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread tater tots on bottom. Spread onion mixture over green beans. Spread turkey mixture over green beans. Sprinkle cheese over entire dish. Bake at 350 for 1 hour, or until cheese on top is melted and golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and sugar. Stir in melted butter. Press mixture firmly into bottom of a 13 x 9 pan. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup morsels with condensed milk. Microwave on high in 30 second intervals, stirring after each, until melted and smooth. Pour mixture over crumbs. Sprinkle remaining morsels and cashews on top. Bake 20 to 22 minutes, til lightly browned. Let them cool completely before cutting into bars.

In a small saucepan over moderately low heat, melt 1 stick of the butter. Continue heating, swirling the pan to prevent burning, until the butter turns nut brown. Transfer the butter to a medium bowl. Using an electric mixer on low speed, gradually blend in the powdered sugar and salt alternately with the milk and vanilla, until the frosting is smooth. Beat in the remaining butter, bit by bit. Refrigerate until mixture is cool and thick enough to spread. Keep frosted cake or cupcakes refridgerated, since the frosting has a tendency to soften and drip off the sides if it gets too warm.

Heat oil and butter in skillet. Add chicken and saute over med-high heat, turning often to lightly brown. Put chicken into baking pan. Saute onions and garlic, add tomatoes, tarragon, vinegar, capers& wine. Pour over chicken and bake in 350 degress oven for 30 to 45 minutes, depending on size of chicken breast.
Heat oven to 350 degrees. Tear 2 pita breads into chip-size pieces and brush with oil. Sprinkle with lime zest and chilli flakes. Bake for 10 mins until crisp. Sprinkle with salt if you like.

Mix all ingredients together in a glass bowl. Place lamb in a extra large heavy-duty plastic bag or glass bowl. Pour the marinade over the lamb, and turn to coat well on all sides. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Place in the fridge for a minimum of 24 hours. When ready to grill, remove from fridge and save marinade for basting if desired. Turn the grill to high heat. Sear both sides for about 5 minutes on each side. Reduce grill temperature to medium heat and finish cooking the lamb. You may baste the lamb with the leftover marinade if desired.

In a small saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves. Add lemon peel and lemon juice, stir and remove from heat. Let cool completely, then strain into a clean pitcher. In a blender, puree the pint of tecumseh sunrise and add to the raspberry ice cubes. Stir well and refrigerate. In a blender,

In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Saute the chicken in hot oil for 5-8 minutes or until no longer pink, stirring constantly. Add in the mushrooms, garlic, ginger, and cayenne pepper. Cook 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add in the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, and cooked pasta. Toss to coat. Cook a couple of minutes or until pasta is heated through

Whisk together milk, water, cocoa powder, sugar, extra dark chocolate, rum, pepper, chocolate. Add milk and cook, stirring, until hot. Add vanilla and stir. Pour chocolate into serving cups and top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with a little cinnamon and nutmeg and serve with a cinnamon stick.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add in onion and saute until golden. Add in sliced cabbage, cider vinegar, sugar, celery seeds and black pepper. Mix to combine and cook until the cabbage if crisp-tender and the liquid is reduced to a glaze. Season with salt.

Heat the oil in a medium saucepan, over medium high heat. Add the artichoke hearts, salt, olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, dried tarragon, red pepper, fresh cilantro and bring to a boil over medium high heat, then reduce heat to medium low, partially cover the pan and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the pan from heat and let stand 5 minutes without removing lid. Fluff with a fork and stir in the artichoke hearts, salt, olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, dried tarragon, red pepper, fresh cilantro and bring to a boil over medium high heat, then reduce heat to medium low, partially cover the pan and simmer for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork and stir in the artichoke

In a 4-quart saucepan, combine the cranberries, water, sugar, unsalted butter, salt, vanilla extract, sour cream. Bring to a boil over high heat, and continue boiling until thickened, about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Cool to room temperature. Just before serving, fold in the sour cream and mix well.

Place the salmon on a broiler pan and baste with the sauce. Let sit for 15 minutes. Broil them until cooked through, about 8 minutes, basting again with the glaze. Remove the salmon from the heat and baste once more with the glaze before serving.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugars. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

This step will take approximately 20 minutes, so preheat oven to 350 degree f. In a large pot cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Return to pot. Add milk, melted butter, pepper, and salt. Stir in cheeses. Transfer to a greased 2-quart casserole. Bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes. Carefully stir mixture. Sprinkle with crushed crackers. Bake 5 minutes more or until crackers are browned and mixture is just heated through. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes. Add the chicken stock cubes and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes. Add salt, pepper and flour. Mix thoroughly. Add milk gradually and simmer for 5 to 8 minutes, stirring constantly.

In 1 quart saucepan, combine sugar and cornstarch. Gradually stir in water until smooth. Cook over medium heat, stirring often until boiling. Boil 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice, zest, beaten egg yolks, butter and milk. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Fold into lemon mixture. Pour into buttered 6 cup casserole dish. Place this casserole inside a large pan. Pour hot water into the 9x13 pan to a depth of about 1 inch. Bake at 350 degrees for about 40 minutes or until the topping is set and golden brown. During baking this separates into a cake-like topping with a lemon sauce beneath.

Heat oil in lg skillet or dutch oven. Add garlic. Cook and stir 1 minute. Add tomatoes, beans, italian seasoning and sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Add spinach. Cook 3 minutes. Put drained pasta on serving plates. Top with tomato mixture. Sprinkle with feta and olives.

In a medium saucepan cook maple glazed carrots, covered, in a small amount of boiling salted water for 8 to 10 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. Remove carrots from pan. In the same saucepan cook maple glazed carrots, covered, in a small amount of boiling salted water for 8 to 10 minutes or until crisp-tender. In the same saucepan cook maple glazed carrots, covered, in a small amount of

Place the first 7 ingredients in a mixer, mixing till blended. Stir in the remaing ingredients. Spoon on to a parchment lined cookie sheet pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes. Remove and let set for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a medium bowl mix sugar, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne pepper, honey, oil. Add pecans and toss well. Drizzle honey and oil over spiced nuts and mix well so they are evenly coated. Spread on greased baking sheet and bake 7 - 10 minutes until sugar is caramelized. Let it cool for 5 minutes and take it of the sheet otherwise they might stick to the bottom. If that happens put it back in oven to melt the sticky sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Sift flour with sugar, soda salt and cinnamon into a large bowl or food processor by pulsing 3-4 times. Mix in shortening and knead thoroughly. Shape into balls using 1 tablespoon of dough. Place on ungreased baking sheets and make a depression in the top with the thumb. Press a blanched whole or sliced almond into the center of each cookie. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes. Makes six dozen.

Boil water in a large saucepan over high heat. When water comes to a rapid boil, turn off heat, put the tea bags into water and cover. After the tea has steeped about 1 hour, pour the sugar into a 2-quart pitcher, then add tea. The tea should still be warm so the sugar will dissolve easily. Add lemon juice. Chill. Makes 2 quarts.

Heat oil in a large saucepan, add onion and garlic, cook, stirring until the onion is soft. Pour the chicken stock into the saucepan with the onion and garlic and bring to the boil. Add the potatoes, boil uncovered for 5 minutes. Stir in the peas, bring to the boil and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the chopped potatoes are tender. Blend potato and pea mixture in batches until smooth. Serve with a swirl of cream and chopped mint.

Heat oil in large skillet over high heat. Add green beans and saute till beans are just tender, about 5 minutes. In a small bowl stir together soy sauce, minced garlic, honey and ginger. Pour over green beans in skillet and boil until sauce thickens and coats vegetables, about 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and mix until just moistened. Spoon into lined or nonstick, sprayed mini muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove muffins from the tray and cool on a wire rack.

Heat oil in a wok until very hot. Stir fry celery ribs for 2 to 3 minutes. Add broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots and saut on medium heat adding cup of water can help steam the vegetables. Cover pan for about 2 minutes. Cover for 1 to 2 minutes. Then uncover and saut until done ideally 1 more minute to keep veggies crisp. Salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place cream cheese in a medium sized mixing bowl. Saute onions in butter until softened. Add onions, seafood, wine and swiss cheese to cream cheese. Stir until combined. Spread into a greased 2 quart baking dish and top with cheddar cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden brown.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a baking sheet with olive oil spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool.

Place the satsuma oranges in a large skillet over medium heat, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until tender. Drain, and set aside to cool. In a large bowl, mix together the sour cream, mayonnaise, sugar, half of the onions, and half of the cheese. Gently stir in the cooled satsuma oranges. Top with remaining cheese and onions, and sprinkle bacon bits over the top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the cherry tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin pan with cooking spray. Beat sugar and eggs together until thickened. Add melted butter and almond extract. Beat well. Add flour. Stir in cranberries and pecans. Fill muffin pan. Since these do not raise much fill the cups to the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until browned on top and done in center. Cool on wire rack.

Heat the oil in a large non stick fry pan. When it is hot, add the thighs in one layer and saute them over medium to high heat for 4 minutes on each side or until nicely browned. Remove the chicken to a platter. Add the onions to the dripping in the pan. Saut for 1 minute. Stir in the garlic, wine and coriander stems only and saut for 1 minute longer. Return the chicken to the pan, add lemon salt and pepper. Bring the surrounding liquid to the boil. Cover the pan, reduce the heat and boil gently for 15 minutes. Stir in the coriander leaves and serve 2 thighs per person. Serve with rice or cous cous.

In a medium bowl, using a fork or potato masher, mash the avocados until chunky. Add the onion, cilantro, bell pepper, and chile. In a small bowl, combine the lime juice and package of hidden valley original ranch salad dressing & seasoning mix. Add to the avocado mixture along with the pepper and stir gently to combine. Transfer the dip to a serving bowl and place a piece of plastic wrap directly on the surface of the guacamole, pressing to eliminate any air pockets. Serve at room temperature. This dip is best when made within 8 hours of serving, but it can be prepared up to 1 day in advance. Cover and refrigerate. Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before serving, but keep covered until ready to serve.

Drain and reserve liquid from fruit. Add enough water to make two cups of liquid. Pour pudding mix & liquid into a pan. Cook until thickened, stir in dry jello. Mix in pineapple and oranges. Chill until mixture mounds slightly when dropped from a spoon. Fold in three-fourths of the cool whip. Pour into a 13x9 inch pan. Chill for 4 hours or until firm. Cut into squares. Garnish with remaining cool whip.

Place the tofu in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 5 minutes. Drain well. Chill uncovered in the refrigerator until cool enough to handle. Crumble tofu into a food processor and add remaining ingredients. Blend until a very thick, smooth paste forms, stopping to scrape down the sides of the work bowl as necessary. Cover and chill several hours or overnight in order to allow the flavors to blend before serving. Keeps 5 to 7 days in the refrigerator.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except bread and butter. Mix until the cornstach is disolved. Transfer mixture to a shallow bowl or pan. Dip both sides of each bread slice into the mixture. Melt butter on the griddle or skillet. Place bread on heated surface and cook each side to a light golden brown. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees celsius. Butter 9 inch fluted or plain tube pan. In large bowl of electric mixer, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, eggnog, and vanilla. Stir together flour, bakng powder, and salt. Gradually beat into butter mixture. Prepare topping by combining nuts, sugar and cinnamon. Scatter half the topping evenly over bottom of pan. Spoon in half batter. Add remaining topping and spoon on remaining batter. Bake 50 to 60 minute, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 15 minutes before removing from pan.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine oil, rosemary, garlic, salt and pepper in large bowl. Add potato slices and turn them until throughly coated with the dressing. Arrange in baking dish, slightly overlapping each slice. Place in the oven and bake for 60 minutes until golden crisp.

In a saucepan, combine orange juice, cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla, heavy whipping cream, graham cracker pie crusts with ice cream. Pour into crust. Chill 2-3 hours or until firm. Garnish with cool whip and cherries.

In 4-quart saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic in butter 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until tender. Stir in flour, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Stir in broth, broccoli and corn. Heat to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender. Stir in half-and-half. Cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 2 loaf pans with non stick coating. In a large bowl, mix flour, splenda, baking powder, and salt. In a separate bowl mix together the eggs and egg whites, canola oil, and the grated zucchini. Stir the liquid mixture into the flour mixture. The dough will be somewhat thick. Stir until the flour mixture is just moistened. Spread evenly into the loaf pans. Bake 50 minutes.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until onion is translucent, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes with their liquid, pinto beans, lima beans, brown sugar, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until lima beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in white kidney beans, heat through. To serve, ladle soup into warm serving bowl. Sprinkle with 1 to 2 ounces shredded cheddar cheese if desired.

In a large skillet, brown the salted chicken pieces in oil. Cook over medium-high heat for 10 minutes or until browned. Crush garlic cloves and scatter over the chicken add the broth. Turn heat to low. Cover and cook for about 15 minutes each side or until cooked through. Remove cover, add salt and red pepper flakes. Add water and simmer over low heat until water is cooked off. Remove cover, add garlic, green chiles and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Stir in salsa. Remove from heat. Gently fold in cubed cheddar cheese. Serve immediately over beds of rice.

Boil potatoes in skins and cool, peel and grate. Combine with 4 tblsp butter, melted. Stir in cheese until almost melted. Blend with rest of the ingredients. Put in a 2 quart pan sprayed with cooking oil. Dot the top with 2 tblsp butter. Cover and bake at 300 about 25 minutes.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms, onions and garlic, salt and pepper to taste. Saute to desired doneness. Add tomato sauce, and simmer for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley you can serve this on rice, or as a side dish, hot or cold or luke warm. You can put this on a ham sandwich. Yummm. You can put this in an omelette and top with mozzarella and parmesan. You can add hot sauce or peppers to your liking. This is very versatile.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add egg mixture and cook, while stirring, so that the eggs do not set too fast. The eggs will begin to set and form a creamy sauce. Add in the remaining butter, one piece at a time, continuing to stir. Arrange the toasts on serving plates. Once the eggs set spoon them over the toast, season with pepper and the remaining herbs, and serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until the oil is melted. Add the bacon, italian seasoning and parsley and cook, stirring occasionally, until the oil is melted. Add the bacon, italian seasoning and parsley

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line 9 inch pie pan with pastry. In large bowl combine all filling ingredients except butter and toss lightly. Spoon filling into crust lined pan. Cut 4 slits in top of crust. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cover edge of crust with strips of foil after 20 minutes of baking to prevent excessive browning. Cover edge of crust with strips of foil after 20 minutes

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a large glass baking dish with foil,. Put the ground beef in a large bowl and add the onion and garlic, knead together, add bread crumbs and italian seasoning -- mix all together. Add the egg and milk -- knead together well with hands --. Form pieces of meat into 1 inch balls, place in baking dish -- bake for about 20-30 minutes --. I usually put them in a large pan on the stove and cover with spaghetti sauce for a few minutes at medium heat, but thats optional.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray 9x13 pan with non-stick cooking spray. Arrange tenderloins in pan and sprinkle with mozzarella. In seperate bowl, mix tomatoes, chicken stuffing, and water. Mix until stuffing is moistened. Spread evenly over chicken. Bake for 30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.

Whisk eggs, chives, salt, and pepper together in medium bowl. Heat butter in large non-stick skillet. Pour in egg mixture and cook over medium heat until almost set, lifting sides to let uncooked egg run under. Sprinkle omelet with cheddar cheese. Run omelet under hot broiler just until cheese is melted, bubbling, and just beginning to brown. Cut into 4-6 servings and serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, melt butter along with olive oil. Saute chicken along with orzo for approximately 10 minutes. Add chicken broth and rice, coat evenly and toast together. Add mushrooms and chicken, fold in sour cream. Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Simmer covered until rice and pasta is done, about 20 minutes. Simmer covered until rice and pasta

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, mix together rice, cream of celery soup, butter, frozen green beans, mushrooms, swiss cheese. Stir, in potatoes and kielbasa. Spoon into a 7x11 inch casserole dish. Place casserole on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 90 minutes or until potatoes are tender and flavors blended.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a plastic bag, combine butter, baking potatoes, parmesan cheese, flour, salt and pepper. Mix well. Place potatoes inthe bag and toss to coat with mixture. Pour butter into an 8x8-inch baking dish. Stir in potatoes, coating well. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 1 hour and 15 minutes, to 1 hour and 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Preheat oven to 180c. Grease or line cookie tray. Mix together sugar and butter. Add egg yolk and vanilla, mix well. Stir in flour and choc chips. Place teaspoonfuls onto tray and bake for 12 minutes.

Place baguettes in a large bowl, cover with foil-lined baking sheet. Coat baguettes with cooking spray and season with salt and pepper. Preheat broiler. Cook baguettes 10 to 12 minutes or until fish is opaque. While fish is cooking, combine avocado, sour cream, mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic, hot-pepper sauce, worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper in a food processor. Process, scraping down bowl occasionally, until mixture is creamy and smooth. Serve a dollop of sauce next to each avocado sandwich.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake romaine lettuce for 30 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Remove from oven and let

Preheat oven to 450. Toss corn and oil to coat and spread out on a large baking sheet. Bake, stirring once, until some kernels begin to brown, about 20 minute. Combine garlic, rosemary, and beef. Brown beef on all sides, then add shallot, red wine vinegar, and balsamic vinegar. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove beef with tongs and place in a bowl quickly saut arugula in remaining juices for approximately 5 seconds. Remove beef with tongs and place in a bowl quickly saut arugula in remaining juices

Heat oil in a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Add turkey burgers and cook 4 to 6 minutes per side, until cooked through. Serve the cheese-stuffed burgers with this meal and refrigerate remaining burgers until ready to use. Serve burgers on rolls.

Heat butter and oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and cook for a further 30 seconds. Add stock. Simmer for 15 minutes. Cool slightly before pureeing. Return to the heat and stir in the yoghurt. Serve drizzled with cream and with pappadums.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and sauté for about 5 minutes. Add the zucchini and cook for another 5 minutes. Add

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine the pumpkin puree, condensed milk, eggs, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg. Mix well and turn into the crust. Bake 15 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 350f. In a large bowl

Cream butter and sugar. Add sifted dry ingredients. Roll into balls and place on a greased oven tray and flatten. Place a chocolate button in the centre of each biscuit. Bake for 15 - 20 minutes at 175c.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Combine turkey meat, chilies, onion, soup. If desired, spread tortillas with butter. Cut each tortilla in half and arrange 6 halves over bottom of a 13- x 9-inch baking dish. Spread a third of the turkey mixture over tortillas, top with a third of the cheese. Reapeat layers of tortillas, turkey, and cheese two more times. Carefully pour the chicken broth over all. Cover and bake for 25-30 minutes or until heated throughout and bubbly. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes. Cut in squares with sharp knife and use a spatula to remove each serving.

Place pork chops on top of pressure cooker stir together half of the can of lemon juice, lemon juice, mace, and bouillon granules. Mix well. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 7 hours. Warm the other half of pressure cooker stir together half of the can of lemon juice, lemon juice, mace, and bouillon granules. Place pork chops on top of mixture. Cover and cook on

Spray rack of boiler pan with nonstick spray. Preheat the broiler. Whisk together the brown sugar, mustard, and dill in a small bowl. Sprinkle on the broiler rack and spoon the brown sugar glaze on top. Position 7 inches from the heat and broil until lightly browned and just opaque in the center, about 6 minutes.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugars. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

In a large microwave-safe bowl combine the white sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup and peanut putter. Microwave on high for 3-4 minutes or until melted, stirring once. Stir in vanilla. Fold in rice cereal and the chopped peanuts until well combined. Spread into a lightly buttered 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish. Cover and chill for 1 hour or until set. Cut into squares.

In a large pot or dutch oven heat oil over medium-high heat. Add scallions, celery, and onions, stir until vegetables are wilted, approximately 5 minutes. Add broth and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and add peas, stir until vegetables are wilted, approximately 5 minutes. Remove from heat and carefully transfer to bowl of food processor or blender, do this in batches if necessary. Add

Place all ingredients in a food processor fitted with a metal blade and process just until mixture is powdery -- about 30 seconds. Be careful not to overprocess. Store in an airtight container for up to 6 months. To make cozy hot chocolate, combine 1 cup of milk and 2 tablespoons of the mix in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and add in vanilla. Whisk together sugar, cocoa, water, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a saucepan over medium heat. Add milk and cook, stirring, until hot. Add vanilla and stir. Pour chocolate into serving cups and top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with a little cinnamon and nutmeg and serve with a cinnamon stick.

In a small saucepan on medium heat, warm the vinegar and sugar together until the sugar dissolves. Set liquid aside to cool. Chop the dill. Slice the cucumber very thinly and arrange in layers on a shallow, non-reactive platter with sloped edges. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and garnish with the fresh dill. Pour the dressing over the cucumbers. Let marinate at least 1 hour or overnight. Yield is estimated.

Place tofu on a cooling rack with a baking pan underneath to catch excess liquid. Bake for 10 minutes, turn tofu and bake for another 15 minutes, or until the edges start to brown. Remove tofu from the water and drain the saucepan. Place tofu on a cooling rack with a baking pan underneath to catch excess liquid. Bake for 10 minutes, turn tofu

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and lemon-pepper seasoning. Transfer them to a sheet pan and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until crisp outside and tender inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the brussels sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugars. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl, with electric mixer at medium speed, beat together butter and shortening until light and fluffy. Add sugar and cream together until very light. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each egg. Gradually fold in flour until a soft, workable dough forms. Shape into balls and place on cookie sheets. Dip the bottom of a flat bottomed glass in sugar and use it to mash down the balls of dough. Bake in preheated oven until done. Immediately remove from pan to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Using a baking sheet with a lip, melt butter. Mix seasoning into the butter, and then toss in almonds. Bake in a 350 oven for about 10-12 minutes, stirring once, until nuts are lightly toasted and fragrant. Remove from heat and serve warm or at room temperature.

Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion slices, garlic, and mushrooms. Stir to combine. Pour over meat. Cover slow-cooker and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve meat and sauce over noodles.

Rinse flank steak and pat dry. In a 1-gallon zip lock bag or large bowl, mix the soy sauce, olive oil, brown sugar, green onions, sesame seeds, garlic, pepper, and ginger. Add the steak, seal bag or cover bowl tightly, and chill, turning occasionally, at least 4 hours or up to 2 days. Lift steak from the bag and let drain briefly. Place meat on a grill over a solid bed of medium-hot coals or medium-high heat on gas grill. Close lid on gas grill. Cook steak, turning occasionally to brown evenly, for medium-rare, 9 to 12 minutes,, transfer steak to a platter and let stand 10 minutes, cut meat across grain into thin slanting slices,.

Heat oven to 400f. Mix first six ingredients and form into cocktail size meatballs. Place on jelly roll style pan with lip. Bake meatballs in oven for 15-20 minutes until done. Melt butter in saucepan. Add garlic and saut for 1-2 minutes. Stir in flour. Stir in chicken broth and cook until thickened. Combine meatballs and sauce. Keep warm in crockpot if serving for party.

Place chicken on top of low calorie greens. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or until juices run clear. Stir in the chicken. Cover and cook on high for 20-30 minutes or until juices run clear. Stir

In a medium saucepan, combine 2 cups water, sugar, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, and cool completely. Stir in lemon juice and remaining 2 cups water. Refrigerate. Serve chilled over ice. Garnish with maraschino cherries, fresh mint, and lemon slices, if desired.

In a large skillet, cook the rice in oil over medium-high heat, stirring, until golden brown. Add salt, water, bouillon and soy sauce. Cover tightly and simmer 20 minutes longer or until all liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.

In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, melt butter and olive oil together. Add the remaining ingredients to the skillet. Stir until potatoes are evenly coated with spice mixture and onion slices are evenly distributed. Cook covered on medium heat for 15 minutes, tossing and turning the potatoes every few minutes. Potatoes will be done when slightly browned and fork-tender.

In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the tomatoes and cook, tossing and stirring often, until the skins begin to split, about 3 minutes. Do not over cook. Remove from the heat and toss with the herbs. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Makes 4-6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl, stir together butter, garlic, cheese and parsley. Remove biscuits from container. On baking pan with sides, make 2 loaves of 5 biscuits each. Set the biscuits on their sides, just touching each other end to end, like they were in the can, only in 2 groups of 5. Split each biscuit in half. Separate biscuits into 20 pieces, then cut biscuits into 4 pieces. Toss biscuits with bacon and other ingredients. Put all this into tube pan and drizzle with butter. Bake for 25-30 minutes.

Cook noodles according to pkg. Directions. Drain. Meanwhile saute the cabbage in the chicken broth until tender, about 10 minutes. Add cooked noodles and mix well. Add salt, pepper, garlic powder to taste. Take the pan off the heat and fold in the sour cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray 9 by 13-inch casserole dish with pam. Put ceilidh cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts and mix until dough rolls up into a ball. Pinch off pieces and roll into 1-inch balls. Roll out and add 2 tablespoons of your favorite filling. Fold dough over filling. Seal with water and fry in hot oil. Make sure dough is sealed or filling will ooze out during cooking.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine cake mix, water and almond extract in large mixing bowl. Beat at low speed with mixer until moistened. Beat at medium speed for one minute. Line medium muffin pans with paper baking cups. Fill muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown, cracked and dry. Remove from muffin pans. Cool completely. Frost with frosting.

In a large saucepan combine the chocolate, cream, butter and butter and heat over moderate heat, stirring, until chocolate is completely melted. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and a pinch of salt. Transfer to a bowl and chill for 4 hours, or until firm. Form mixture by heaping teaspoons into balls and roll lightly in peanuts. Chill on a baking sheet lined with wax paper for 1 hour, or until firm. Chill on a baking sheet lined with wax paper for

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a bowl. Set the mixture aside. Bake for 5 to 7 minutes. Let the cookies sit for 2 minutes before cooling on wire racks.

In a wok or skillet, heat oon sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add chopped onion, chopped garlic cloves and a peeled and minced ginger. Stir-fry for a minute or so until the onion begins to turn translucent. Add the kangkong, finely chopped bird chili pepper, water and soy sauce. Continue to stir-fry just until the onion begins to turn translucent. Add the kangkong, finely chopped

Preheat oven to 350. Line baking pan with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray. Combine first 5 ingredients in a large zip-top plastic bag. Add salmon. Seal and marinate in refrigerator 20 minutes. Prepare grill or broiler. Remove salmon from bag, reserving the marinade. Place salmon on a grill rack or broiler pan coated with cooking spray, and cook for 6 minutes on each side or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Baste salmon occasionally with the reserved marinade.

Toast the egg sandwich. In a microwaveable cup roughly the same diameter of the egg, add the egg, a tablespoon of water. Beat the egg, add the bacon. Microwave on high for 1 to 2 minutes while egg is toasting. Assemble the egg sandwich. In a microwaveable cup roughly the same diameter

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine apples, pecans, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, vanilla, brown sugar, sugar, pecans, butter, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Bake for approximately 30-35 minutes, until a knife inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean. Cool on a rack, then cover and refrigerate for a minimum of 2 hours. Remove from the heat and add pecans. Mix well and pour into crust. Remove from the heat and add pe

Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil then cover and reduce heat. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Drain well, then return potatoes to the pot. Add the butter, milk and salt and mash well. Stir in parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl mix all dry ingredients. Add milk and water and add-ins of your choice. Using your fingers knead into an elastic dough. If you need more flour just add it and if you need more liquid add more water or milk. Flatten the dough to desired thickness and cut out scones of desired size. Place scones on a paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

In buttered casserole dish, place cleaned and trimmed chicken breasts, and season with salt and pepper, if desired. Pour italian salad dressing over to coat and let marinate in the fridge for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. After the hour of marinating, turn chicken breasts over and sprinkle evenly with oregano and grated parmesan cheese. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 1 hour, checking after 45 minutes to make sure they do not get over-cooked.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray muffin tins with nonstick spray. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl. Mix in beaten eggs, applesauce and melted butter. Evenly scoop mixture into muffin pans. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Test to see if toothpick comes out clean.

In a large mixing bowl beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar, beating until stiff peaks form. Fold in vanilla and pecans. Drop by well-rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 200 degrees for 50-55 minutes or until firm to the touch. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 425f. Peel, core and thinly and thickly slice the apples. Toss with lemon juice if using. Combine and mix apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon and nutmeg. Pour into crust-lined pie plate. Dot with butter. Place top crust, seal and vent. Cover edges of crust with narrow band of aluminum foil, shiny side out. Bake at 425f for 20 minutes. Reduce temperature to 375f and bake another 30-40 minutes until filling is bubbling and crust is nicely browned. If necessary remove foil last 10 minutes to brown edges. Remove foil last 10 minutes to brown edges. Remove foil last 10 minutes

Place beef in slowcooker. Add sliced onions. Mix together the vegetable juice, brown gravy mix, garlic, pepper and thyme. Pour liquid mix over beef in slowcooker. Cover with the lid and cook on low for about 7-8 hours or until desired doneness.

Cook brussels sprouts in boiling salted water according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, melt butter in a small saucepan over med. Heat with onion. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Stir in flour and remaining ingredients, stirring and heating until mixture is bubbly. Pour sauce mixture over cooked brussels sprouts and toss gently to coat. Serve.

Heat 1 tbs oil in a saute pan over medium-high heat. Fry onions until crisp and reddish-brown, about 10 minutes, then drain on paper towels. Put garlic and chile in saucepan and fry for 20 seconds or until just beginning to brown. Add lentils and water. Partially cover and cook for 30-35 minutes, or until lentils are soft. Serve lentils with onions on top.

Mix pudding and pineapple in bowl. Gently stir in 1 cup of the whipped topping. Place half of the brownie cubes in 2-quart serving bowl. Top with half of the pudding mixture, half of the raspberries, and half of the remaining whipped topping. Repeat all layers. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until ready to serve.

Combine all dry ingredients together. Cut in shortening. Add flour, butter, baking powder, salt and pepper with as much flour as will fit. Pulse, adding the rest of the flour in batches, until all is coarsely chopped. Bake until bubbling, 25-30 minutes. Remove foil, and continue baking until golden, 15-20 minutes more. Remove foil, and continue baking until golden

In a medium saucepan, over medium heat, combine the sugar, salt, butter and milk. Bring to a boil, then boil for 1 full minute. Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter, oats, vanilla and chocolate milk mix. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Let stand until completely cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown beef and onions in skillet. Drain. Mix in tomato sauce, garlic and oregano. Place in a 2-quart casserole dish. Top with corn. Then spread mashed potatoes over the corn. Lay cheese over the mashed potatoes in a single layer. Bake for about 25-30 minutes or until the cheese is completely melted.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Mix all ingredients in lg bowl. Mix well. Pour into crust. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake another 40 min, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Garnish with pecans if desired.
Cook cauliflower in slow cooker until tender-crisp. Remove from heat and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Combine flour and sugar in a large bowl or food processor. Add margarine and process, or mix together with your fingers, until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add cold water, one tablespoon at a time, and process, or mix, until a manageable dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and roll into a 12-inch circle. Press dough into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie pan or removable-bottom tart pan. Prick the bottom all over with a fork, cover dough with foil and fill with dried beans or rice. Bake 10 minutes. Remove beans and foil and bake until crust is golden brown, about 20 minutes more. Remove from oven and cool completely on a wire rack. Yields 8 slices per crust.

Heat oil in skillet over high heat. Brown chicken in two batches, 6 to 8 minutes. Set aside. In same skillet over medium heat, cook ginger, onion, and garlic, stirring until browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Add soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar. Cook over high heat until thick, 3 to 4 minutes. Add chicken. Stir to warm. Remove from heat. Stir in scallions.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Saut crushed garlic for 1-2 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce. Add salt, pepper, and pesto. Add cream cheese and stir or whisk well until fully melted. Stir parmesan cheese until melted. Add cream and stir well.

In a large non-stick skillet coated with cooking spray, cook beef and peppers over medium heat until meat is no longer pink, drain. Stir in the salsa, corn, and water and bring to a boil. Stir in tortilla strips, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until meat is no longer pink, drain. Sprinkle with cheese, cover and cook 2-3 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve with sour cream.

Place your prepared champagne in a serving dish. In a pot add the raspberry juice, lemongrass and sugar. Heat gently, no boiling until the sugar is completely dissolved. Do not use juice until it is completely cooled. Strain the juice and pour over the champagne wedges. Sprinkle with the raspberry rind, cover, chill for at least 3 hours. Serve in small bowls with a scoop of ice cream or sherbert and garnish with the sprigs of mint.

Place fried rice in a wok or frying pan. Add rice, soy sauce, eggs, teriyaki sauce and ham. Let sit 10-15 minutes stirring occasionally. The less you stir it the more crunchiness there will be. The more you stir it the more crunchiness there will be. Let sit 10
Combine the coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl. Whisk together mayonnaise, pineapple tidbits, green bell pepper, celery, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add mayonnaise,

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Add to skillet. Cook and stir until eggs are completely set. Sprinkle with cheese and let stand until cheese has melted.

In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup, raspberriespreparation:In a large saucepan, combine vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, lime juice, cranberry juice, simple syrup

In small bowl, combine all dressing ingredients. Beat at low speed until smooth. Cover and refrigerate for several hours to blend flavors. Combine salad ingredients in large bowl. Serve on a bed of lettuce leaves.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Line a greased 9x9 pan with bread. Combine broccoli with margarine, cheese, salt, tobasco, and onion. Spoon over bread. Beat eggs, add milk powder and water, mix well, pour over broccoli. Bake at for 20-25 minutes.

Place a steamer basket in a saucepan filled with one-inch of water. Bring to a gentle boil. Add potatoes. Cover and cook just until tender, 15-20 minutes. Toss occasionally. In a serving bowl, combine vinegar and dijon. Season with salt and pepper, and toss.

Preheat oven to 350f. Toss together berries and apples, spread evenly over bottom of 8x8 baking dish. In medium bowl combine sugar, flour, cinnamon and oats. Using pastry cutter work butter into oat mixture until crumbly. Spread over fruit, pressing down lightly. Bake 40-45 minutes or until top is lightly browned. Cool before serving. Top with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk until well combined. Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Combine with egg mixture. Pour in buttermilk and stir until just combined.

In a large saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a light boil. Cook and stir for 2 mins. Pour into a large container. Add boiling water, sugar, lemon juice, cranberry-strawberry drink and blend until smooth. Squeeze and remove tea bag and add tea to berry mixture, blending until smooth. Adjust consistency with additional water, if needed and sweeten with honey, if desired. Makes 1 large or 2 small servings.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. Cover broiler pan or cookie sheet with foil and spread asparagus in one layer. Spray with cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 12 minutes or less. Heat butter in a small skillet on low heat until lightly brown. Add vinegar and soy sauce. Pour over cooked asparagus.
Combine all ingredients in a jar with a lid. Cover and shake to mix thoroughly. Let stand at least 2 hours to blend seasonings. Shake well before using. Wonderful on italian blue cheese dressing.

Heat the olive oil and garlic in a large skillet over medium heat. When garlic is tender, remove from skillet and set aside. Place the broccoli and carrot in the skillet, and cook 2 minutes, just until cooked through. In a pot, bring the vegetable broth to a boil. Add the partially cooked pasta and broth to the skillet. Mix in the peas. Cover skillet, and continue cooking 10 minutes over medium heat, or until pasta is almost al dente. Remove and discard garlic clove. Transfer the partially cooked pasta and broth to the skillet. Cover skillet, and continue cooking 10 minutes over medium heat, or until pasta is almost al dente and vegetables are tender. Toss with the parmesan cheese to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners. Stir together flour, sugar, baking soda and baking powder. In a separate bowl, combine yogurt, egg, vanilla, oil and fruit. Stir mixtures together just until combined. Batter will be very thick. Scoop into prepared muffin cups and bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. This helps the leavening process.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees farenheit. Place chicken in ungreased 13 x 9 x 2 inch oblong pan. Mix the remaining ingredients together. Pour over chicken. Cook uncovered, spooning oil mixture over chicken occasionally, for 30 minutes. Turn the chicken and cook until thickest pieces are done, about another 30 minutes. Garnish with lemon slices.

Heat a saute pan on medium high heat. Add in garlic, butter, wine, and half and half. Cook for 10 minutes or until reduced by half. Add in the fresh basil and the clams. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Portion a half cup of linguini on each plate, top each plate with equal portions of the clam sauce. Garnish with parmesean cheese and chopped fresh parsley and enjoy.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook, covered for 20 - 25 minutes or until nice and crispy and cooked through. Turn about 4 or 5 times to avoid burning. Drain on paper towels and serve hot with rice or noodles.

Heat oil in a saucepan, add onion and saute until soft. Remove seeds and rib of pepper, chop, add to saucepan and cook for 5 minutes. Add stock and thyme. Season with salt and simmer for about half an hour. Serve with cooked rice.

In a 3 quart saucepan, melt butter and saute onions. Add potatoes, water, and bouillon cubes. Cover and bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium. Cook just until potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, place frozen broccoli and cheddar cheese in crock pot on low to start melting and thawing. Once the potatoes are done, using a hand blender, blend contents of saucepan to desired consistency and then pour into the crock pot. Heat on low until warmed.

In a cocktail shaker, place the twelve mint leaves, 6 pieces of lime and the simple syrup. With a muddler, mash up the lime pieces and mint leaves so that they release their flavors and oils. Taste for sweetness and adjust if necessary. Add the rum and a handful of ice. Shake vigorously for 20 seconds or until ice crystals form. With a cocktail strainer, pour into a tall ice-filled glass. Top off with club soda. Garnish edge of glass with a slice of lime.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper. Wash and cut potatoes into somewhat uniform chunks. Pat dry. Crush and break rosemary and thyme leaves by hand. Put potatoes, olive oil, rosemary and thyme into a container with a lid and shake well to coat the potatoes. Spread potatoes on baking sheet in a single layer. Salt and pepper to taste. Bake 45 - 60 minutes or until nicely brown, stirring and turning occasionally.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour to form a roux, cooking until bubbly. Whisk in 1 jar of clam juice, until smooth. Pour in half-and-half, and rest of clam juice, stirring constantly. Stir in clams, reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Season with pepper and serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Brush the petersons with 1 teaspoon of the oil, reserving the remaining oil. Roast the petersons in a pan until golden and soft, about 10 to 15 minutes. Watch carefully so garlic does not get over-brown or burn. Carefully remove pan from oven and cool. When cool enough to handle, squeeze out the garlic pulp. Combine the pulp with the reserved olive oil and rest of the ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth and use the dressing on any mixed garden salad. Refrigerate leftover.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine all dry ingredients, except chocolate chips, in a large mixing bowl and mix well. In a seperate bowl, slightly beat the eggs with a fork or wire whisk. Add thwe remaining wet ingredients to the eggs and stir well. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients. Stir just until evenly mixed. Fold in chocolate chips. Coat 2 bread pans evenly with cooking spray. Pout half of the mixture into each pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes.

Rinse lentils, discarding and stones, or blemished lentils. Drain. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until hot. Add onion and bell pepper, cook and stir 5 minutes or until tender. Add cumin and ground red pepper and stir 1 minute. Pour in the 4 cups of water and the lentils. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Stir in salt and simmer 10 minutes more or until lentils are tender. Stir in lemon juice and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread one side of each slice of bread with 1 teaspoon mustard and 1 tablespoon 1000 island. Spread one side of each slice of bread with 1 teaspoon mustard and 1 tablespoon 1000

Heat oil on medium high heat in large skillet or frying pan. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine dry ingredients. Moisten chicken pieces with water. Dredge chicken in flour and crumb mixture. Quickly fry chicken on all sides until browned and crisp. Place in covered baking dish and bake additional 20-30 minutes to re-crisp chicken, serve.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until fragrant. Add the parsley and cook until fragrant, about 3 minutes per batch. Add the olive oil and

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Combine remaining ingredients except rice and add to skillet. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 5-10 minutes. If mixture is too thick after simmering, add milk to desired thickness. Serve over warm white rice.

Heat broiler, with rack set 4 inches from heat. Place chicken on a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Broil, without turning, until opaque throughout, 7 to 9 minutes. Let cool briefly, then flake. Divide chicken and tomatoes among serving plates. Top with chicken, spinach, tomatoes and olives. Top with sliced chicken breast.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Brush a large baking dish with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Put green beans, onion, and garlic in dish, drizzle with remaining oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 25 minutes, stirring beans at least 3 times. When tender, remove beans from oven and transfer to bowl. Immediately drizzle with vinegar. Add hearts of palm, tomatoes, pine nits and pepper to taste and toss. Serve warm or room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 9 by 13-inch casserole dish with pam. Put broccoli, garlic salt and pepper in a bag and toss. Place cabbage and ham in alternate layers in a 2-quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Mix together soup and milk. Pour over cabbage and ham. Top with buttered bread crumbs. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees celcius. Add milk and mix well. Spray a 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray. Spoon the mixture equally amongst the 12 cups. Bake till browned on the top. Should be 10 to 15 minutes.

Heat the oil in a pan add leeks and garlic and cook until soft. Add carrots, garlic, stock and water and cook covered until pumpkin is soft. Spoon 2 cups of liquid out, blend or process soup until smooth. Add pepper to your liking. Serve soup in bowls pour a about 1-2 tablespoons of cream over top and serve immediately. Makes about 6-8 servings great for lunches or as a starter.

Preheat oven to 475 degrees f. Toss sugar, salt, pepper and peas in a medium bowl. Transfer to a baking sheet and spread in a single layer. Roast in the oven, stirring once halfway through, until the peas are tender and beginning to brown slightly, 12 to 14 minutes. Serve warm, sprinkled with bacon if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. In a large mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt and brown sugar. Pour in beer, stir until a stiff batter is formed. It may be necessary to mix dough with your hands. Scrape dough into prepared loaf pan. Bake in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 400. Cover broiler pan or cookie sheet with foil and spread asparagus in one layer. Spray with cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 12 minutes or less. Heat butter in a small skillet on low heat until lightly brown. Add vinegar and soy sauce. Pour over cooked asparagus.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray. In a bowl gently mix all your ingredients until well combined. Transfer meat mixture in loaf pan and gently press down. Bake until internal temperature reaches 180 degrees, about 1 hour and 15 minutes. As an option you can brush the top of the meatloaf with a little extra wing sauce when you pull it out of the oven to give it a better appearance.

In a large sauce pan, melt butter or margarine. Add garlic and onion and cook until onion is re-hydtrated. Add tomatoes, green chili, salt and cilantro. Add water. Simmer for 30 minutes. This can also be made in a crock pot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease muffin cups or use paper liners. Mix oats, flours, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Whisk eggs and brown sugar in another bowl. When smooth, whisk in milk, melted butter and vanilla. Pour over dry ingredients and fold in just until dry ingredients are moistened. Scoop into mufifn cups. Bake 15 to 25 minutes or until springy to the touch in the center.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the onions in a large baking dish. Arrange the potatoes and the red and green peppers alternately in a spoke pattern in a shallow, 12-inch round baking dish. Pile the onions in the center. Scatter the garlic over the top. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with rosemary, salt and black pepper. Bake in the preheated oven until the vegetables are lightly golden and tender, or about 45 minutes. Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs.

In small saucepan, combine pudding mix and gelatine. Add water and lemon juice. Stir until smooth. Cook and stir 1-2 minutes longer or until thickened. Remove from the heat. Cool clightly. Pour into crust. Cover and refrigerate for 3 hours or until set. Spread with whipped topping.

Spray a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Cook ham steak in skillet over medium heat for 3 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Remove ham from skillet and keep warm. Squeeze lemon over pan, scraping up brown bits from the bottom of the pan. Add butter to pan. Once butter is melted, add garlic, parsley and tomatoes. Cook over medium heat for approximately 5 minutes, or until golden brown. Squeeze lemon over pan, scraping up brown bits from the bottom

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place apples in a 2-quart square baking dish. Stir in the granulated sugar. For topping, in a medium bowl combine the oats, brown sugar, flour, spices and salt. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the nuts. Sprinkle topping over filling. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until fruit is tender and topping is golden. Cool slightly. Serve warm with ice cream or caramel sauce.

Cook noodles in boiling water until tender. Drain noodles and cut cup but not too small. Cook, peel and cut up hard boiled eggs. Add to noodles and eggs. Add enough miracle whip to moisten. Add horseradish and pepper. Lastly, add still frozen green peas just 5 to 10 minutes prior to serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease muffin tins or line with paper cups. Combine bran cereal, oat bran, flour, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl beat the eggs. Beat in buttermilk, honey and oil. Add to dry ingredients and stir just enough to blend. Fold in prunes. Pour into muffin cups and bake 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Mix butter, brown sugar, egg, vanilla, rolled oats, all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips. Roll into balls and press down with glass dipped in flour. Press a quarter of a maraschino cherry in center. Bake 350f for 8-9 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450f. Grease or spray a large cookie sheet. Stir together dry ingredients including the sugar. Cut butter into flour mixture. Add raisins, stir to mix well. Beat egg in measuring cup. Add milk to make 1 cup. Stir into flour. Drop roughly tablespoon size scoops on cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes.

In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta until it is al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain, and set aside. In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta until it is al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes. In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta until it is al dent

Spray soup pot with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add the milk, sugar, pasta, whole milk, sugar, butter. Bring to a boil. Then reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Add shredded cabbage and cook for 10-15 minutes or until cheese is melted and soup is heated through. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees fahrenheit. On a cookie sheet pan place strips of bacon and bake until crisp. Remove bacon set aside. Drain the fat and discard, leaving just a touch. Place potatoes on pan and make small indents with the back of a spoon. Crack eggs into each indent. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with the bacon.

Cover chicken with water in a large pot. Cook 1 hour and remove chicken. Meanwhile, prepare remaining ingredients, and add to pot after removing chicken, and cook for 1 hour.
